titlestmt.titleproper: Record of the Trustees of the Wagner Free Institute of Science 1855-1884
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Record of the Trustees of the Wagner Free Institute of Science

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. The Board of Trustees of the Wagner Free Institute of Science was incorporated in 1855 with the object of overseeing the financial, educational, and operational activities of the Institute. Early board members included William Wagner, who was "President for life," Robert Cornelius, D. Rodney King, Charles J. Stille, J. Vaughan Merrick, Samuel Wagner, Jr., and Professor Henry Coppee.

scopecontent.p: This volume contains a handful of meeting minutes of the Trustees of the Wagner Free Institute of Science dating from 1855 to 1884. The majority of the volume contains transcriptions of correspondence regarding the appointment of members of the Board of Trustees.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Wagner Free Institute of Science: other collections that include significant amounts of Trustee records include: Board of Trustees meeting minutes (89-030 ), director's files and business records (90-010), and Communications to the Board of Trustees (91-025).
